p: Previously, it has been reported that the essential oil of S. thymbra possesses a moderate anti proliferative and concentration dependant inhibition of viability of C32 (human amelanotic melanoma cell line) and ACHN (renal cell adenocarcinoma) [ 6]. Cytotoxicity of the essential oils of other Satureja species were evaluated on several cell lines such as J774 macrophage, 5637, KYSE, Fem-X Human Malignant Melanoma, Vero, SW480, MCF7, JET3, A549, THP-1 and HT29/219 [ 3].
